Perturbation-based Post-hoc Explanations for Image Attribution
  • post_hoc
  • View page source

post_hoc

post_hoc.connectors Module

Classes

SegmentationAttribuitionPipeline(segmenter, ...)

Creates an image attribution pipeline that automatically performs and connects segmentation, sampling, perturbing, model prediction, and attribution.

SegmentationPredictionPipeline(segmenter, ...)

Creates an image perturbation pipeline that automatically performs and connects segmentation, sampling, perturbing, and model prediction.

post_hoc.explainers Module

Classes

CIUAttributer([expected_util, return_samples])

Calculates CIU values for each feature combination in return_samples or each feature combination in Z if return_samples is None.

LinearLIMEAttributer()

Calculates attribution of each feature with LIME by fitting a linear surrogate model with the least squares method.

OriginalCIUAttributer([inverse, expected_util])

Calculates CIU values without intermediate concepts according to the py.ciu.image package.

PDAAttributer([divide_weight, mode, c, n])

Estimates the prediction difference analysis of each feature by calculating the difference between the true prediction and the average prediction when each feature is perturbed.

RISEAttributer()

Calculates the attribution as is done in the RISE method.

SHAPAttributer()

Estimates the shapley value attribution of each feature using KernelSHAP.

post_hoc.evaluation Module

Classes

ImageAUCEvaluator([mode, perturber, ...])

Evaluates an image attribution through calculating the area under the deletion curve by deleting pixels/segments from most to least attributed (mif) or deleting the least attributed first (lif).

PointingGameEvaluator()

Calculates the Pointing Game score of an attribution as the fraction of the most attributed pixels that lie within the ground truth segmentation.

post_hoc.image_perturbers Module

Classes

ColorHistogramPerturber([nr_bins])

Creates perturbed versions of the image by replacing the pixels indicated by each perturbation mask with the median color of one bins of a histogram of the image chosen randomly weighted by the size of the bins.

Cv2InpaintPerturber([mode, radius])

Creates perturbed versions of the image by inpainting the pixels indicated by 0 using either of the two inpainting methods implemented by OpenCV.

RandomColorPerturber([uniform_rgb, ...])

Creates perturbed versions of the image by replacing the pixels indicated by each mask with a randomly drawn color.

ReplaceImagePerturber(replace_images[, ...])

Creates perturbed versions of the image by replacing the pixels indicated by each perturbation mask with the corresponding pixel from other images.

SingleColorPerturber([color])

Creates perturbed versions of the image by replacing the pixels indicated by each perturbation mask with a given color.

TransformPerturber(transform, **kwargs)

Creates perturbed versions of the image by replacing the pixels indicated by each perturbation mask with the corresponding pixel from a transformed version of the image.

post_hoc.image_segmenters Module

Functions

perturbation_masks(segment_masks, samples)

Creates images masks indicating where the image should be perturbed using masks indicating where each segment is and rows of samples denoting which segments to include in each sample.

Classes

FadeMaskSegmenter(segmenter, sigma, **kwargs)

Segments an image using the wrapped segmenter and then smoothens the edges of the segmentation masks by applying a gaussian filter.

GridSegmenter(h_segments, v_segments[, bilinear])

Segments an image into a grid with a given amount of rows and columns.

WrapperSegmenter(segmenter, **kwargs)

Segments an image using a given segmentation function that returns a [H,W] array and then splits that array into a mask per segment.

post_hoc.image_visualizers Module

Classes

AUCVisualizer()

Makes a matplotlib plot showcasing the AUC scores for provided curves.

HeatmapVisualizer([normalize, image_weight, ...])

Creates a numpy images showing the attribution of the image by creating a heatmap overlaid on top of the original image.

TopVisualizer([k, p, percent, treshold, ...])

Creates a numpy image showing the top attributed segments by perturbing the lower attributed segments.

post_hoc.samplers Module

Classes

RandomSampler([p])

Creates an array of samples where each feature is included (=1) with a given probability and to be perturbed (=0) otherwise.

SampleProbabilitySampler([distribution, inverse])

Creates and array of samples where each feature is set to be perturbed (=0) or not to be perturbed (=1) with a probability that, for each sample, is drawn from a given distribution.

ShapSampler([inverse, ignore_warning])

Creates an array of samples indicating which features to perturb (0) and which to include (1) of a given size.

SingleFeatureSampler([inverse, add_all, ...])

Creates an array of all possible samples where only a single feature is indicated to be perturbed (set to 0) or, if inverse, is indicated to not be perturbed (set to 1).

post_hoc.torch_utils Module

Classes

ImageToTorch(*args, **kwargs)

Transforms one or more images from a numpy array to a PyTorch tensor.

TorchModelWrapper(model, input_transforms[, ...])

Wraps around a PyTorch model and makes it work with numpy code.
